intro: Convolvulus leiocalycinus, commonly known as the slender bindweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar climbing or trailing habits. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
